contentrichtext.text: {{About|the Portuguese band|the Tool album|Ænima}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = Aenima | image = | caption = The first studio session with Susana, photo by Ana Carvalho{{deletable image-caption|Monday, 14 December 2009|date=July 2011}} | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Almada]], [[Portugal]] | genre = [[Gothic rock]], [[ethereal wave]] | years_active = 1997–present | label = | associated_acts = Millennium, Poetry of Shadows, Isiphilon, [[Ava Inferi]] | website = [http://www.aenima.org/ www.aenima.org] | current_members = Susana<br>Rune<br>Paulo<br>Rui | past_members = Carmen<br>Pedro<br>Lito<br>Hugo<br>Nor<br>Joao<br>Rui<br>Miguel<br>Vasco<br>Mario }} '''Aenima''' is a Portuguese [[gothic rock]] band formed in [[Almada]] in 1997. The name of the band is a play on the [[Latin]] word ''anima'', meaning "soul".<ref>[http://www.aenima.org/ Official biography]</ref> The band is notable for its guitar-based ambient sound and clear female vocals. Critics quite often compare the band to [[Cocteau Twins]] and [[Dead Can Dance]].<ref>[http://www.twilight-zone.it/reviews/A/aenima.htm Twilight Zone Review of "Never Fragile:]</ref><ref name="webbworks">[http://www.webbworks.org/thelodge/aenimainterview.htm Interview with Aenima]</ref><ref>[http://old.gothic.ru/music/review/07-03-01_e.htm#1 Russian Gothic Project Review of "Revolutions"]</ref> Aenima was founded by guitarist and producer Rune (previously with Millennium) and vocalist Carmen (previously with Poetry of Shadows and Isiphilon). They soon added bassist Paulo, guitarist Nor and drummer Hugo to their line-up.<ref name="fluxeuropa-revolutions">[http://www.fluxeuropa.com/mn0104-aenima.htm Flux Europa Review of "Revolutions"]</ref> Carmen was the band's main lyricist during her years with Aenima. Aenima's debut LP album, ''Revolutions'', was released in 1999 by the Symbiose label. Originally the band was signed for a two-album deal, but their record label soon went out of business, so Aenima had to look for another publisher.<ref name="fluxeuropa-revolutions"/> The follow-up record, ''Never Fragile'', was released by Equilibrium Music in 2002. With its 6 tracks, ''Never Fragile'' is considered to be an [[Extended play|EP]] or [[maxi-single]]. It was highly praised by critics.<ref>[http://www.projekt.com/product.asp?dept%5Fid=20&sku=EQM00002 Projekt: darkwave Review of "Never Fragile"]</ref><ref>[http://www.fluxeuropa.com/aenima-never_fragile.htm Flux Europa Review of "Never Fragile"]</ref> In 2003, Aenima released their second full-length album, ''Sentient'', via the US-based Middle Pillar Presents label, becoming the first European act to be signed by the label.<ref>[http://www.projekt.com/product.asp?dept_id=20&sku=MPP00984 Projekt: darkwave Review of "Sentient"]</ref><ref>[http://www.fluxeuropa.com/aenima-sentient.htm Flux Europa Review of "Sentient"]</ref> Carmen left the band after ''Sentient'' was released. She was soon replaced with a new singer, Susana, a graduate of Lisbon Conservatory. As of 2007, the band was working on recording their new, yet-unnamed album.<ref name="webbworks"/> ==Discography== * 1999 - ''Revolutions'' (Symbiose) * 2002 - ''Never Fragile'' (Equilibrium Music, EQM00002) * 2003 - ''Sentient'' (Middle Pillar Presents, MPP00984) * 2004 - ''Puppet Circus'' (Picture Disc) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.aenima.org/ Official website] [[Category:Gothic rock groups]]
